The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 22 July is 53,818 (6,229.1 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 17 July, there were 4,215 new confirmed cases (487.9 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 10 July, there were 2,415 new cases and so the new cases have risen by 75% (1,800 extra cases).
